noun.description: The purple egg-shaped fruit of a tropical Old World plant, which is eaten as a vegetable; an eggplant.
The large plant of the nightshade family that bears eggplants.

origin: Late 18th century: from French, from Catalan alberginia, from Arabic al-bāḏinjān (based on Persian bādingān, from Sanskrit vātiṃgaṇa).
